feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for New Zealand issued by MetService

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 100 to 120 mm of rain, especially about the higher ground. Intensities of 15 to 25 mm per hour are possible, especially from Tuesday afternoon. Further heavy rain is likely from Wednesday afternoon or evening. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal. Changes: Upgraded to Warning (Orange).

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 80 to 100 mm of rain, but accumulations may reach 140 mm about Great Barrier Island and the Eastern Bays. Downpours of 25 to 40 mm per hour are possible, mainly in the east. Downpours may or may not be accompanied by thunderstorms. Another period of heavy rain is possible from Wednesday afternoon or evening. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low. Changes: Upgraded to Warning (Orange).

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Over a broad area, expect 90 to 110 mm of rain, but in the north and east accumulations may reach 150 mm, or possibly more. Downpours of 25 to 40 mm per hour are possible, especially in the north and east. The downpours may occur with or without thunderstorms. Another period of heavy rain is likely from Wednesday afternoon or evening. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low. Changes: Upgraded to Warning (Orange).

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited
